page.title: 14 Horrid Hill
page.content: The Horrid Hill peninsula is a narrow causeway jutting north eastwards from an area called Sharps Green. It terminates in a rounded sandy hill. The causeway once gave access to a cement works on Horrid Hill. It is surrounded by extensive estuarine mud flats which are a Wetlands Site of Special Scientific Interest. The dry causeway leading into the area is therefore very useful for ornithologists. At high tide Horrid hill is an important site for rod anglers offering some of the best land based sea angling on the Medway.
